newsitem.title: USA: U.S. attache sees Bangladesh wheat tender in Jan.
newsitem.headline: U.S. attache sees Bangladesh wheat tender in Jan.

text.p: An agricultural attache at the U.S. embassy in New Delhi said Bangladesh is expected to tender for 100,000 tonnes of wheat in early January.

In a report dated Nov. 30 that was released in Washington this week, the attache said the 1996/97 wheat import estimate for Bangladesh remains unchanged at 2.0 million tonnes, consisting of 1.35 million tonnes commercial and 650,000 tonnes concessional.
The attache said so far during 1996/97, wheat purchases by the private trade have reached 95,000 tonnes, with 75,000 tonnes from the United States and 20,000 from Australia.
